titleInfo.title: Fabrication and characterization of EUV multilayer mirrors optimized for small spectral reflection bandwidth

mods.abstract: Our aim was to produce EUV multilayer mirrors with a small spectral bandwidth DeltaE less than or equal to 3 eV at 70 eV peak energy using UHV electron beam evaporation by varying the thickness ratio (Gamma = d(Abs)/d(Sp) + d(Abs)) between the absorber layer and the bilayer. The deposition process was controlled by in situ soft X-ray reflectometry, and ion-beam polishing as well as substrate-heating methods were applied to reduce the interface roughness. The reflection properties of the Mo-Si multilayer mirrors prepared were characterized by hard and soft X-ray reflectometry and details of the multilayer structure were revealed from cross-sectional transmission electron microscopy.

bibliographicCitation.mla: Lim, YC, Westermalbesloh, T, Aschentrup, A, Wehmeyer, O, Haindl, G, Kleineberg, U, and Heinzmann, Ulrich. “Fabrication and characterization of EUV multilayer mirrors optimized for small spectral reflection bandwidth”. APPLIED PHYSICS A-MATERIALS SCIENCE & PROCESSING 72.1 (2001): 121-124.
